dlinkSwDhcpRelayMIB.name: dlinkSwDhcpRelayMIB

revisions.description: This is the first version of the MIB file for 'BOOTP/DHCP Relay' functionality.

1.Update dDhcpROption82RemoteIdUserDef and dDhcpROption82CircuitIdUserDef value length(Note:follow UIS). 2.Remove dDhcpRIfIgnoreBootpRowStatus and add dDhcpRIfIgnoreBootpEnabled(Note:follow IP interface). 3.Remove dDhcpRIfAgentInfoChkRowStatus and modify dDhcpRIfAgentInfoChkState SYNTAX(Note:follow IP interface). 4.Remove dDhcpRIfAgentInfoInsertRowStatus and modify dDhcpRIfAgentInfoInsertState SYNTAX(Note:follow IP interface). 5.Remove dDhcpRIfAgentInfoPolicyRowStatus(Note:follow IP interface). 6.Remove dDhcpRIfAgentInfoTrustRowStatus and add dDhcpRIfAgentInfoTrustEnabled(Note:follow IP interface).
1.Modify dDhcpROption82RemoteIdUserDef and dDhcpROption82CircuitIdUserDef value length for IWL test. 2.Update dDhcpRVlanLocalRelayCrlSecond2K description

dlinkSwDhcpRelayMIB.contactinfo: D-Link Corporation Postal: No. 289, Sinhu 3rd Rd., Neihu District, Taipei City 114, Taiwan, R.O.C Tel: +886-2-66000123 E-mail: tsd@dlink.com.tw
dlinkSwDhcpRelayMIB.description: This MIB module defines objects for BOOTP/DHCP relay.

dDhcpRelayAgentInfoCheckEnabled.name: dDhcpRelayAgentInfoCheckEnabled
dDhcpRelayAgentInfoCheckEnabled.description: This object indicates whether the DHCP relay agent validates the relay agent information option in the received DHCP reply packet.

dDhcpRelayAgentInfoInsertEnabled.name: dDhcpRelayAgentInfoInsertEnabled
dDhcpRelayAgentInfoInsertEnabled.description: This object indicates whether the DHCP relay agent inserts relay agent information option (option 82).

dDhcpRelayAgentInfoPolicy.name: dDhcpRelayAgentInfoPolicy
dDhcpRelayAgentInfoPolicy.description: This object indicates the re-forwarding policy of DHCP relay agent information option 82. drop (1) - discards the packet that already has the relay option. keep (2) - the DHCP requests packet that already has the relay option is left unchanged and directly relayed to the DHCP server. replace (3) - the DHCP requests packet that already has the relay option will be replaced by a new option.

dDhcpRelayInfoTrustAll.name: dDhcpRelayInfoTrustAll
dDhcpRelayInfoTrustAll.description: This object indicates whether the DHCP relay agent trusts the DHCP relay information for all interfaces.

dDhcpRelaySmartRelay.name: dDhcpRelaySmartRelay
dDhcpRelaySmartRelay.description: This object indicates the status of smart relay function. By default, the relay agent sets the gateway address field of the packet to the primary address of the interface. When the received interface of the packet has secondary addresses and smart relay is enabled, relay agent will count the number that a client retries sending of the DISCOVER message. The relay agent will switch the gateway address to secondary address of the received interface after three retries.

dDhcpROption82RemoteIdType.name: dDhcpROption82RemoteIdType
dDhcpROption82RemoteIdType.description: This object indicates the type of remote ID sub-option. default(1) - MAC address of VLAN 1. userDefined(2) - The value of dDhcpROption82RemoteID is used. vendor2(4) - System Name. vendor3(5) - The value of dDhcpRPortIfOp82RemIdVendor3Cfg of the corresponding entry is used.

dDhcpROption82RemoteIdUserDef.name: dDhcpROption82RemoteIdUserDef
dDhcpROption82RemoteIdUserDef.description: This object indicates the global user defined string as the remote ID of the device. This object can be modified when dDhcpROption82RemoteIdType is set to 'userDefined'. When read, a zero length string is returned when dDhcpROption82RemoteIdType is not 'userDefined'.

dDhcpROption82CircuitIdType.name: dDhcpROption82CircuitIdType
dDhcpROption82CircuitIdType.description: This object indicates the type of circuit ID sub-option. default(1) - VLAN ID, Module ID and Port Number. userDefined(2) - The value of dDhcpROption82CircuitID is used. vendor1(3) - VLAN ID, Slot ID, Port Number and MAC address of VLAN 1. vendor2(4) - Port Number. vendor3(5) - The value of dDhcpRPortIfOp82CirIdVendor3Cfg of the corresponding entry is used. vendor4(6) - System Name, Module ID, Port Number and Client's VLAN ID. vendor5(7) - System Name, 'eth', Chassis ID, Slot ID, Port Number and Client's VLAN ID. vendor6(8) - 'Ethernet', Chassis ID, Slot ID, Port Number, Client's VLAN ID and System Name.

dDhcpROption82CircuitIdUserDef.name: dDhcpROption82CircuitIdUserDef
dDhcpROption82CircuitIdUserDef.description: This object indicates the global user defined string as the circuit ID. This object can be modified when dDhcpROption82CircuitIdType is set to 'userDefined'. When read, a zero length string is returned when dDhcpROption82CircuitIdType is not 'userDefined'.

dDhcpRPoolClassRelayTargetTable.name: dDhcpRPoolClassRelayTargetTable
dDhcpRPoolClassRelayTargetTable.description: A table that contains relay target class configuration for DHCP pools.

dDhcpRPoolClassRelayTargetEntry.name: dDhcpRPoolClassRelayTargetEntry
dDhcpRPoolClassRelayTargetEntry.description: By using DHCP class, DHCP relay uses option configuration to further determine which DHCP relay target for relaying the packet that matches the value pattern of option defined in the class.

dDhcpRPoClRelayTargetPoolName.name: dDhcpRPoClRelayTargetPoolName
dDhcpRPoClRelayTargetPoolName.description: This object specifies a DHCP pool. The value must be same as an entry in dDhcpSPoolTable identified by dDhcpSPoolName.

dDhcpRPoClRelayTargetClassName.name: dDhcpRPoClRelayTargetClassName
dDhcpRPoClRelayTargetClassName.description: This object specifies a DHCP class. The value must be same as an entry in dDhcpSClassTable identified by dDhcpSClassName.

dDhcpRPoClRelayTargetVrfName.name: dDhcpRPoClRelayTargetVrfName
dDhcpRPoClRelayTargetVrfName.description: The name of virtual routing and forwarding (VRF). If this object is a zero length string, the relay target is in global routing and forwarding space.

dDhcpRPoClRelayTargetAddr.name: dDhcpRPoClRelayTargetAddr
dDhcpRPoClRelayTargetAddr.description: This object indicates the IP address of the target server for the class.

dDhcpRPoolRelayDestTable.name: dDhcpRPoolRelayDestTable
dDhcpRPoolRelayDestTable.description: A table that contains DHCP relay destination IP address of DHCP pools.

dDhcpRPoolRelayDestEntry.name: dDhcpRPoolRelayDestEntry
dDhcpRPoolRelayDestEntry.description: By using DHCP class, DHCP relay uses option configuration to further determine which IP addresses to allocate to clients.

dDhcpRPoolRelayDestPoolName.name: dDhcpRPoolRelayDestPoolName
dDhcpRPoolRelayDestPoolName.description: This object specifies a DHCP pool. The value must be same as an entry in dDhcpSPoolTable identified by dDhcpSPoolName.

dDhcpRPoolRelayDestVrfName.name: dDhcpRPoolRelayDestVrfName
dDhcpRPoolRelayDestVrfName.description: The name of virtual routing and forwarding(VRF). If this object is a zero length string, the destination DHCP server IP address is in global routing and forwarding space.

dDhcpRPoolRelayDestAddr.name: dDhcpRPoolRelayDestAddr
dDhcpRPoolRelayDestAddr.description: This object indicates the IP address of the relay destination for the pool.

dDhcpRPoolRelaySourceTable.name: dDhcpRPoolRelaySourceTable
dDhcpRPoolRelaySourceTable.description: A table that contains the configuration of the source subnet that the client packets come from.

dDhcpRPoolRelaySourceEntry.name: dDhcpRPoolRelaySourceEntry
dDhcpRPoolRelaySourceEntry.description: An entry identifying a surce subnet that the client packets come from.

dDhcpRPoolRelaySourcePoolName.name: dDhcpRPoolRelaySourcePoolName
dDhcpRPoolRelaySourcePoolName.description: This object specifies a DHCP pool. The value must be same as an entry in dDhcpSPoolTable identified by dDhcpSPoolName.

dDhcpRPoolRelaySourceSubnet.name: dDhcpRPoolRelaySourceSubnet
dDhcpRPoolRelaySourceSubnet.description: This object indicates the source subnet of the client packets come from of the corresponding entry.

dDhcpRPoolRelaySourceSubnetMask.name: dDhcpRPoolRelaySourceSubnetMask
dDhcpRPoolRelaySourceSubnetMask.description: This object indicates the network mask of the source subnet for the corresponding entry.

dDhcpRIfIgnoreBootpTable.name: dDhcpRIfIgnoreBootpTable
dDhcpRIfIgnoreBootpTable.description: A list of configurations about the BOOTP/DHCP relay will ignore BOOTP packet on an interface. An entry is created/removed when ignoring the BOOTP request packets is enabled or disabled on an interface via CLI or by issuing appropriate sets to this table using snmp.

dDhcpRIfIgnoreBootpEntry.name: dDhcpRIfIgnoreBootpEntry
dDhcpRIfIgnoreBootpEntry.description: Defines an entry in the dDhcpRelayAddrTable.

dDhcpRIfIgnoreBootpIfIndex.name: dDhcpRIfIgnoreBootpIfIndex
dDhcpRIfIgnoreBootpIfIndex.description: The ifIndex value of the interface. Only VLAN interfaces are valid interfaces for this object.

dDhcpRIfIgnoreBootpEnabled.name: dDhcpRIfIgnoreBootpEnabled
dDhcpRIfIgnoreBootpEnabled.description: This object indicates whether the interface ignore the bootp packet or not.

dDhcpRIfAgentInfoChkTable.name: dDhcpRIfAgentInfoChkTable
dDhcpRIfAgentInfoChkTable.description: A list of configurations about the DHCP relay validates the relay agent information (option 82) in the received DHCP reply packet on an interface. An entry is created/removed when checking option 82 is or not configured on an interface via CLI or by issuing appropriate sets to this table using snmp. If checking option 82 is not configured for an interface, the global setting, dDhcpRelayAgentInfoCheckEnabled takes effect. If checking option 82 is configured for an interface, the interface setting takes effect.

dDhcpRIfAgentInfoChkEntry.name: dDhcpRIfAgentInfoChkEntry
dDhcpRIfAgentInfoChkEntry.description: Defines an entry in the dDhcpRIfInfoChkTable.

dDhcpRIfAgentInfoChkIfIndex.name: dDhcpRIfAgentInfoChkIfIndex
dDhcpRIfAgentInfoChkIfIndex.description: The ifIndex value of the interface. Only VLAN interfaces are valid interfaces for this object.

dDhcpRIfAgentInfoChkState.name: dDhcpRIfAgentInfoChkState
dDhcpRIfAgentInfoChkState.description: This object indicates whether the DHCP relay agent validates the relay agent information option in the received DHCP reply packet on the corresponding interface.

dDhcpRIfAgentInfoInsertTable.name: dDhcpRIfAgentInfoInsertTable
dDhcpRIfAgentInfoInsertTable.description: A list of configurations about whether insert option 82 for an interface during relay of DHCP request packets. An entry is created/removed when the insertion of option 82 is or not configured on an interface via CLI or by issuing appropriate sets to this table using snmp. If the insertion of option 82 is not configured for an interface, the global setting, dDhcpRelayAgentInfoInsertEnabled takes effect. If checking option 82 is configured for an interface, the interface setting takes effect.

dDhcpRIfAgentInfoInsertEntry.name: dDhcpRIfAgentInfoInsertEntry
dDhcpRIfAgentInfoInsertEntry.description: Defines an entry in the dDhcpRIfAgentInfoInsertTable.

dDhcpRIfAgentInfoInsertIfIndex.name: dDhcpRIfAgentInfoInsertIfIndex
dDhcpRIfAgentInfoInsertIfIndex.description: The ifIndex value of the interface. Only VLAN interfaces are valid interfaces for this object.

dDhcpRIfAgentInfoInsertState.name: dDhcpRIfAgentInfoInsertState
dDhcpRIfAgentInfoInsertState.description: This object indicates whether insert option 82 for an interface during relay of DHCP request packets.

dDhcpRIfAgentInfoPolicyTable.name: dDhcpRIfAgentInfoPolicyTable
dDhcpRIfAgentInfoPolicyTable.description: A list of configurations about relay agent information re-forwarding policy for the DHCP relay agent on an interface. An entry is created/removed when the re-forwarding policy is or not configured on an interface via CLI or by issuing appropriate sets to this table using snmp. If the re-forwarding policy is not configured for an interface, the global setting, dDhcpRelayAgentInfoPolicy takes effect. If re-forwarding policy is configured for an interface, the interface setting takes effect.

dDhcpRIfAgentInfoPolicyEntry.name: dDhcpRIfAgentInfoPolicyEntry
dDhcpRIfAgentInfoPolicyEntry.description: Defines an entry in the dDhcpRIfAgentInfoPolicyTable.

dDhcpRIfAgentInfoPolicyIfIndex.name: dDhcpRIfAgentInfoPolicyIfIndex
dDhcpRIfAgentInfoPolicyIfIndex.description: The ifIndex value of the interface. Only VLAN interfaces are valid interfaces for this object.

dDhcpRIfAgentInfoPolicyAction.name: dDhcpRIfAgentInfoPolicyAction
dDhcpRIfAgentInfoPolicyAction.description: This object indicates the re-forwarding policy of DHCP relay agent information option 82 for the corresponding interface. drop (1) - discards the packet that already has the relay option. keep (2) - the DHCP requests packet that already has the relay option is left unchanged and directly relayed to the DHCP server. replace (3) - the DHCP requests packet that already has the relay option will be replaced by a new option. none (4) - not configure the policy action on the interface.

dDhcpRIfAgentInfoTrustTable.name: dDhcpRIfAgentInfoTrustTable
dDhcpRIfAgentInfoTrustTable.description: A list of configurations about the relay agent trusts the relay information on an interface. An entry is created/removed when the trusting relay information is enabled/disabled on an interface via CLI or by issuing appropriate sets to this table using snmp. If dDhcpRelayInfoTrustAll is 'true', the dhcp relay information is trusted for all interfaces. If dDhcpRelayInfoTrustAll is 'false', the trust state on an interface is determined whether the corresponding interface exists in this table. If exists, the corresponding interface is trusted, otherwise, the interface is not trusted. When relay information is trusted on an interface, the arriving packets with giaddr==0 (this relay agent is the first relay of this DHCP request packet) but with relay agent information option present will be accepted. If it is un-trusted, these packets will be dropped.

dDhcpRIfAgentInfoTrustEntry.name: dDhcpRIfAgentInfoTrustEntry
dDhcpRIfAgentInfoTrustEntry.description: Defines an entry in the dDhcpRIfAgentInfoTrustTable.

dDhcpRIfAgentInfoTrustIfIndex.name: dDhcpRIfAgentInfoTrustIfIndex
dDhcpRIfAgentInfoTrustIfIndex.description: The ifIndex value of the interface. Only VLAN interfaces are valid interfaces for this object.

dDhcpRIfAgentInfoTrustEnabled.name: dDhcpRIfAgentInfoTrustEnabled
dDhcpRIfAgentInfoTrustEnabled.description: This object indicates whether the interface is trusted on the not.

dDhcpRPortIfOp82RemIdTable.name: dDhcpRPortIfOp82RemIdTable
dDhcpRPortIfOp82RemIdTable.description: This table is used to manage the remote ID sub-option of Option 82 for physical port or port channel interface.

dDhcpRPortIfOp82RemIdEntry.name: dDhcpRPortIfOp82RemIdEntry
dDhcpRPortIfOp82RemIdEntry.description: An entry in dDhcpRPortIfOption82RemIdTable containing the configuration about the remote ID sub-option of Option 82 for the corresponding interface.

dDhcpRPortIfOp82RemIdIfIndex.name: dDhcpRPortIfOp82RemIdIfIndex
dDhcpRPortIfOp82RemIdIfIndex.description: This object indicates the ifIndex value of the port or port channel. Only physical port and port channel interface will appear in this table.

dDhcpRPortIfOp82RemIdVendor3Cfg.name: dDhcpRPortIfOp82RemIdVendor3Cfg
dDhcpRPortIfOp82RemIdVendor3Cfg.description: This object indicates the per port/port channel user defined string as remote ID. This object is used when dDhcpROption82RemoteIdType is set to 'vendor3'.

dDhcpRPortIfOp82CirIdTable.name: dDhcpRPortIfOp82CirIdTable
dDhcpRPortIfOp82CirIdTable.description: This table is used to manage the circuit ID sub-option of Option 82 for physical port or port channel interface.

dDhcpRPortIfOp82CirIdEntry.name: dDhcpRPortIfOp82CirIdEntry
dDhcpRPortIfOp82CirIdEntry.description: An entry in dDhcpRPortIfOp82CirIdTable containing the configuration about the circuit ID sub-option of Option 82 for the corresponding interface.

dDhcpRPortIfOp82CirIdIfIndex.name: dDhcpRPortIfOp82CirIdIfIndex
dDhcpRPortIfOp82CirIdIfIndex.description: This object indicates the ifIndex value of the port or port channel. Only physical port and port channel interface will appear in this table.

dDhcpRPortIfOp82CirIdVendor3Cfg.name: dDhcpRPortIfOp82CirIdVendor3Cfg
dDhcpRPortIfOp82CirIdVendor3Cfg.description: This object indicates the per port/port channel user defined string as circuit ID. This object is used when dDhcpROption82CircuitIdType is set to 'vendor3'.

dDhcpRVlanLocalRelayCrlFirst2K.name: dDhcpRVlanLocalRelayCrlFirst2K
dDhcpRVlanLocalRelayCrlFirst2K.description: This object specifies the DHCP Local Relay enabled VLAN in a string of octets containing one bit per VLAN for VLANs 1 to 2048. If the bit is set to '1', then the VLAN is enabled for DHCP Local Relay.

dDhcpRVlanLocalRelayCrlSecond2K.name: dDhcpRVlanLocalRelayCrlSecond2K
dDhcpRVlanLocalRelayCrlSecond2K.description: This object specifies the DHCP Local Relay enabled VLAN in a string of octets containing one bit per VLAN for VLANs 2049 to 4094. If the bit is set to '1', then the VLAN is enabled for DHCP Local Relay.

dDhcpRelayCompliance.name: dDhcpRelayCompliance
dDhcpRelayCompliance.description: The compliance statement for entities which implement the DLINK-DHCP-RELAY-IPV4-MIB.

dDhcpRGblCfgGroup.name: dDhcpRGblCfgGroup
dDhcpRGblCfgGroup.description: A collection of objects providing global configuration about DHCP relay.

dDhcpRPoolCfgGroup.name: dDhcpRPoolCfgGroup
dDhcpRPoolCfgGroup.description: A collection of objects providing DHCP pool configuration.

dDhcpRInterfaceGroup.name: dDhcpRInterfaceGroup
dDhcpRInterfaceGroup.description: A collection of objects providing per interface configuration of DHCP Relay.

dDhcpROp82SuboptionGroup.name: dDhcpROp82SuboptionGroup
dDhcpROp82SuboptionGroup.description: A collection of objects providing sub-options configuration of option 82.

dDhcpRVlanCfgGroup.name: dDhcpRVlanCfgGroup
dDhcpRVlanCfgGroup.description: A collection of objects which are used to configure as well as show information regarding the feature enabling on each VLAN.
